english.segment1: She walked to the mailbox. On that bright summers day. Found a letter from her son. In a war far away
english.segment2: He spoke of the weather. And good friends that he'd made. Said I'd been thinking 'bout dad. And the life that he had. That's why I'm here today. Then at the end he said. You are what I'm fighting for. It was the first of his letters from war
english.segment3: She started writing. You're good and you're brave. What a father that you'll be someday. Make it home. Make it safe
english.segment4: She wrote every night as she prayed
english.segment5: Late in December. A day she'll not forget. Oh her tears stained the paper. With every word that she read
english.segment6: It said "I was up on a hill. I was out there alone. When the shots all rang out. And bombs were exploding. That's when I saw him. He came back for me. And though he was captured. A man set me free. And that man was your son. He asked me to write to you. I told him i would, oh I swore". It was the last of the letters from war
english.segment7: And she prayed he was living. Kept on believing. And wrote every night just to say
english.segment8: You are good. And you're brave. What a father that you'll be someday. Make it home. Make it safe. Still she kept writing each day
english.segment9: Then two years later. Autumn leaves all around. A car pulled in the driveway. And she fell to the ground. And out stepped a captain. Where her boy used to stand
english.segment10: He said "mom I'm following orders. From all of your letters. And I've come home again", He ran in to hold her. And dropped all his bags on the floor. Holding all of her letters from war
english.segment11: Bring him home... Bring him home... Bring him home...
